item.title: Kristin add a quote by Robert Half
item.description: "There is something that is much more scarce, something rarer than ability. It is the ability to recognize ability." -- Robert Half

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Norman Vincent Peale
item.description: "The way to happiness: Keep your heart free from hate, your mind from worry. Live simply, expect little, give much. Scatter sunshine, forget self, think of others. Try this for a week and you will be surprised." -- Norman Vincent Peale

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description:
"In college, I had a course in Latin, and one day the word "divorce" came up. I always figured it came from some root that meant "divide." In truth, it comes from "divertere," which means "to divert."
I believe that. All divorce does is divert you, taking you away from everything you thought you knew and everything you thought you wanted and steering you into all kinds of other stuff, like discussions about your mother's girdle and whether she should marry someone else." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Mitch Albom
item.description: "Accept who you are; and revel in it." -- Mitch Albom

item.title: Kristin add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "The paths to liberation are numerous, but the bank along the way is always the same, the Bank of Karma, where the liberation account of each of us is credited or debited depending on our actions." -- Yann Martel
